name: MacGabhainns Backpacker Hostel

reviews.text: I spent 3 days in Kilkenny, Ireland in this wonderful hostel. It's quite a walk from the main bus station but you can't miss it. It's totally green :)
reviews.title: One of my favourite hostels

reviews.text: It has about 5 rooms and 2 bathrooms with a very cosy interior. I felt very welcome and a bit like being at home. There's a grandma-style living room with a fireplace and armchairs with dangerously thick fillings ;)
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Nice Staff.

reviews.text: It is run by a local guy an his dog is around all the time, welcoming guests and eager playing with them. The kitchen is very well equipped and clean.
reviews.title: nice hostel, wish we could stay longer

reviews.text: There's a supermarket 5 minutes away and the main shopping street is about 8 minutes by foot.
reviews.title: Lovely hostel, friendly environment

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay very much and definitely will return sometime.
reviews.title: This was Home Sweet Home for me.

reviews.text: Were in kilkenny for weekend, great place to stay clean, friendly and top class showers. Thanks to all at macgabhainns backpackers
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: On arrival to the hostel we were greeted by a guy who runs the hostel and he must have been hungover cause he couldn't handle a group of 9 people showing up at once, we have booked in 2 separate groups 4 in one room and 5 in another, he was annoyed that the 2 rooms were paying separate and he had not one bit of change for any of us. Only we took order and controlled the situation we would have been there all day. We also gladly paid the 100 euros "noise" deposit but looking back we should have known we wouldn't be getting it back.
reviews.title: Crazy owner couldnt handle a large group and went out of his way to make our night hell!

reviews.text: The rooms are a nice size with en suites on the ones we stayed in, all very clean but no hot water, he only heats the water after 6pm which was a pain as we all wanted to shower.
reviews.title: Down to earth and uncomplicated but very clean and welcoming

reviews.text: We came back that night in separate groups, without warning at 4am we got told that enough was enough (no prior warnings to this) and he called the guards for "noise pollution", when we approached the owner to ask what we did wrong and apologise we were greeted with curses and abuse, he genuinely was so out of line and he is lucky we are a nice group and the guys held their anger back because no man should speak to a woman the way he did! when the guards came we were in bed asleep and they woke us and turned the lights on and warned us but it was obvious they were shocked and wondered why they had been called for such a quite bunch.
reviews.title: Nice enough little hostel

reviews.text: Needless to say we didnt get our noise deposit back but I think this is a money making scheme and we were never getting it back.
reviews.title: reasonable value

reviews.text: A group of us stayed here when doing the Kilkenny triathlon. We are all a bit older than the usual hostel crowd but we just wanted somewhere to sleep / shower. Fergus stayed up until our arrival at 2am and was very welcoming. The rooms (4 person en suite) were fine as was the shower in the room and there were more showers / toilets outside the room. The hostel was spotlessly clean but there are two large dogs there and there is a doggy smell! Fergus let us take over the back yard to assemble and store our bikes. The folk who worked there were better than lovely and were welcoming and friendly. The hostel is just a tiny bit out of the town and you think its much further when you first arrive but then you realise its just 2 minutes from the main street. Great place, stay here.
reviews.title: Just what we wanted

reviews.text: I spent one evening in Kilkenny and I wish I had spent more at Mac Gabhainns! The staff were incredibly nice, attentive, and accommodating. They came out of the hostel and into the street to check where my friend and I parked to tell us if we would be ok or not. They gave of us the restaurant and music scene information we needed which allowed us to have a brilliant evening. Also, I mistakenly left my eye glasses behind and sure enough they held onto them and mailed them to the Dublin address that I was staying at! Purely amazing and very willing to go out of their way for their guests:)
reviews.title: Nicest folk in Ireland!
Great
reviews.text: Spent here one night during my solo trip through Ireland in Sep 2011. The hostel is located 5 mins from the downtown Kilkenny with all its pubs and shops and places of interest. It was quite easy to find (I walked from the bus station and followed info from the net). Bed was comfortable and there was an electrical outlet at my bed so it was easy to plugin a laptop. The room was ensuite and I enjoyed that managers paid attention to such details as an air freshener in the toilet room. Basic breakfast was included; tea and coffee available at any time; milk in refrigerator. There shower was great, no need to press button every 30 seconds. Wi-fi worked perfectly both in lobby and in my room. I've even got a map of Kilkenny. Thanks to manager Loraine, the owner Raymond and his nice dogs Tilda and Sonny! One of hostels that I liked most during my trips to Ireland.

Great owner. Cozy hostel. Great place to meet a lot of people. We all went out one night. Clean enough rooms. Glad we got the room with bathroom in it as those in dorms shared two bathrooms and there was a wait for them. No problems here.... Hot showers. Good pressure. Average beds for a hostel. At night it was noisy because it's next to a main road so had trouble sleeping, but not a problem for my husband who had a lot to drink
reviews.title: I don't know if I would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guys who run this place are some pretty sketchy fellows. One of the gentlemen on the staff, Fergus, tried to propostition my girlfriend to have sex with him when I was not there. Displeased, I asked the manager if he saw anything wrong with this, if he considered it to be unprofessional or if he thought it was socially acceptable for a member of staff- a host- to pressure a woman travelling alone in a foreign country to cheat. Unable to articulate an intelligible response, he tried to assault me, jabbed his finger in my face, forgot what he was going to say and told me to get out. A real gem.
reviews.title: Unsafe for women.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 1 night in this Hostel and the noise from traffics and other guests was appalling. There are signs everywhere stating to be quiet after 11pm..at 1am we have other guests roaring and shouting. Also the location is just too far out of town unfortunately.
reviews.title: Too far from town centre

reviews.text: I stayed here last year, so I suppose things could have changed since then. For the price, it is decent. It's clean, the beds are nice, the owner is SO NICE. However, the breakfast is mediocre and the showers aren't great. Worst of all, one night when we were there the hostel was basically broken into. We were sharing a room with a group of girls, and around 2 am they came back to the hostel plastered. Some men forced their way into the hostel with the girls, came into our room, and actually got in our beds. The police were called, fights ensued, and the whole ordeal lasted a few hours. I got no sleep and worst of all I felt violated and threatened. Where was the owner!!?!?
reviews.title: Nice owner, but some serious problems

reviews.text: Stayed here recently with a group of friends. Upon arriving we asked where the advertised free parking was... to be told its ok park in the pay and display, nothing will happen. To be fair over the three days nothing happened but still felt risky and a bit misled!!
reviews.title: Be fair! You get what you pay for!

reviews.text: Beds were very comfortable i must say and had a great sleeps on both nights, there was absolutely no noise, and I am an extremely light sleeper!!!
reviews.title: Nice, except for...

reviews.text: When we arrived, another group had cancelled and so the young man in charge, upgraded us all to a lovely en-suite. Delighted!
reviews.title: Homey Hostel, Very nice owner...

description: Property Information:Proudly voted best hostel in Kilkenny in 2011 Macgabhainns Backpackers Hostel is a small hostel located in the heart of the city centre, just ten minutes' walk from Kilkenny Castle, close to the railway and bus station.We offer a comfortable and friendly atmosphere for weary travellers.We have lots of free facilities, such as free breakfast, parking, security lockers, internet access, Wi-Fi and even a free map of the city! Breakfast includes porridge, corn flakes, toast and tea or coffee; you can also have as much free tea and coffee as you want, all day long. We even wash your dishes for you!There's a cool barbecue area in our garden. We're also located near pubs with traditional Irish music and some fine restaurants that are quite inexpensive.We were voted the best hostel in Kilkenny in 2011, and one of the top hostels in Ireland. We were approved by the Irish Tourism Board in 2012 and are recommended by Lonely Planet, Routards and Let's Go.We look forward to seeing you soon!
